title: [BUG] Uncaught 500 Server Error for search runs with bad input with postgres backend

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information

- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:  CentOS Linux 7
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.25.1
- **Python version**: 3.9.7
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: N/A


### Describe the problem

This client code with a local server with a postgres backend throws a 500 error instead of a user input error.
```
import mlflow
experiment = mlflow.get_experiment(0)
mlflow.search_runs(experiment_ids=[experiment])
```
Bad input on the user's part does not get caught. Could this get updated to throw a RestException with invalid user input rather than throwing a 500 error and holding up the server for > 30 seconds.


### Tracking information

MLflow version: 1.25.1
Tracking URI: http://localhost:5000/
Artifact URI: local-artifacts

### Code to reproduce issue

```
import mlflow
experiment = mlflow.get_experiment(0)
mlflow.search_runs(experiment_ids=[experiment])
```
And with tracking client as well.
```
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
client = MlflowClient()
experiment = mlflow.get_experiment(0)
client.search_runs(experiment_ids=[experiment])
```

### Other info / logs

Client error:
```
MlflowException: API request to http://localhost:5000/api/2.0/mlflow/runs/search failed with exception HTTPConnectionPool(host='localhost', port=5000): Max retries exceeded with url: /api/2.0/mlflow/runs/search (Caused by ResponseError('too many 500 error responses'))
```
Server error:
```
 [11/May/2022:15:54:51 -0400] "POST /api/2.0/mlflow/runs/search HTTP/1.1" 500 290 "-" "mlflow-python-client/1.25.1"
```
